text: Hi Svenja. Did you learn HTML and Visual Basic in school?
The great thing about computing and technology is that there are so many ways to learn and get experience. And it's easy to start learning other aspects to get into a new field.

For example, my Bachelor courses were quite broad, giving me a very good overview of many things. Not that I need all of it on a daily basis but it's good to have some understanding of semi related topics
I'm German, so I'm not too familiar with the British education system. How long do you go to school and when do you usually start to go to universities? Do you already have a plan in mind?

Hello Mentor,

Yes, I did learn HTML and Visual Basic in school, especially Visual Basic for my main exams at the age of 15/16 which are our GCSEs. We now go to collage or sixth form for two years in order to get out A-levels and finally later to university. So far my plan consists of getting work experiences in areas of science and technology - where so far I have completed a two week experience at Imperial Collage provided by the NHS in different hospitals.
Hi Svenja. What did you build with HTML and Visual Basic? So you want to get work experience while going to college before going to university?

Hello Mentor.
For HTML we created a basic website knowing how to create tables, change format, loading images, adding hyperlink and such. On the other hand with Visual Basic I created a game quiz based on general knowledge for my course work. Also   in regards to work experience, I've been told to obtain as much as I can for it'll be beneficial for me to decide on my choice of career and also as a requirement for my university reference.
